I didn't like the original Daario, but that was fine because I didn't care for the book Daario. I think the audience will like the new guy more. He seems likable, unthreatening and charming but that's not necessarily who the character is supposed to be. To me, Daario can't be trusted and he's a bit sleazy. Ed Skrein (Daario 1.0) portrayed that pretty well. I think D D want Dany's relationship to bloom with him and Michiel Huisman (Daario 2.0) is a better romantic fit. I don't think the audience would have warmed up to Ed the way they will for Michiel.
All I can see is: Hello. My name is Inigo Montoya. You killed my sister. Prepare to die.

That's Kevin Eslinger, from Colorado! He goes all over the country, and comes to the North Texas area every year. I can't help but buy a piece from him every time. Super nice guy to talk to, as well. I went to Denver and popped into his gallery where we chatted for a while and then he recommended some things to do while I was in town. Nice guy. Awesome art.

WRITING.TITLE: Looking for karaoke in Denton on a Friday or Saturday night. Any suggestions?
WRITING.TEXT: Seems like everyone has karaoke, but they are usually on weekdays, and as someone who has to work the next day at 7 am, I'd love to find a place that hosts karaoke on the weekends. There are several places out of town that offer it, but I need some liquid confidence to get on that stage and driving out of town just doesn't work. I'd appreciate any suggestions that you can offer!
